backbone

Class Layer

  • java.lang.Object
    • backbone.Layer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Layer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class the holds all of the information about a "layer" or piece of the image. This includes the image before filtering, the image after filtering, and how the image should be filtered. This layer also has a specific position and size on the display. Additionally, layers can be placed in a specific order.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      A short matrix containing the blue color values for the original image.
      double contrast
      The amount of contrast in the image 0 represents the amount of contrast being shown regularly, 1 represents no contrast, and a negative number indicates increased contrast over the initial image.

      A boolean representing whether or not the image should be grayscaled.

      The size of the selection bars around the image when the layer is selected

        A boolean representing whether or not the colors of the image should be inverted

      • invertedalpha

        public boolean invertedalpha
        A boolean representing whether or not the alpha channel of the image should be inverted

      • redarray

        public short[][] redarray
        A short matrix containing the red color values for the original image. The first argument represents width or "x" while the second represents height or "y".

      • greenarray

        public short[][] greenarray
        A short matrix containing the green color values for the original image. The first argument represents width or "x" while the second represents height or "y".

      • bluearray

        public short[][] bluearray
        A short matrix containing the blue color values for the original image. The first argument represents width or "x" while the second represents height or "y".

      • x

        public double x
        The leftmost coordinate of the image. The bounds are from [0, 1]

      • y

        public double y
        The topmost coordinate of the image. The bounds are from [0, 1]

      • xsize

        public double xsize
        The width of the image. A size of 1 indicates that if centered, it would occupy the entire image.

      • ysize

        public double ysize
        The height of the image. A size of 1 indicates that if centered, it would occupy the entire image.

        public Layer(double a,
     double b,
     double c,
     double d,
     java.net.URL meh)
        Initializes the layer and all of its components from a URL. The image is read into the component matrixes and the updater Threads are initialized.
        Parameters:
        a - starting "x" position on-screen
        b - starting "y" position on-screen
        c - starting width
        d - starting height
        meh - original image stored in a URL
